clinical_study.brief_title: Esophageal Motility in Eosinophilic Esophagitis Evaluated by High Resolution Manometry.
clinical_study.official_title: Esophageal Motility in Eosinophilic Esophagitis Evaluated by High Resolution Manometry - Effect on Esophageal Motility of Standard Therapy.

brief_summary.textblock: Esophageal Motility in eosinophilic esophagitis will be evaluated by High Resolution Manometry before and after medical treatment - motility is suspected to change/improve after therapy.

detailed_description.textblock: After identification of eosinophilic inflammation of the esophagus -> differentiation between GERD and eosinophilic esophagitis (via pH/MII-measurements or PPI-trial) -> High-resolution manometry (HRM) for evaluation of esophageal motility in patients with eosinophilic esophagitis (exclusion of GERD-patients)-> initiation of budesonide-therapy -> after eight weeks of therapy reevaluation of esophageal motility by HRM

primary_outcome.measure: Improvement of esophageal motility (IBP) measureable in high resolution manometry (HRM)
primary_outcome.description: Average maximum intra-bolus-pressure (IBP) [mmHg] before and after therapy

secondary_outcome.measure: Improvement of esophageal motility (e.g. specified in the chicago classification) represented in high resolution manometry (HRM)
secondary_outcome.description: weak peristalsis with small/large breaks, frequently failes peristalsis, absent peristalsis, hypertensive peristalsis, rapid contractions with normal latency, functional EGJ-obstruction, panesophageal pressurizations, compartimentalized pressurizations;

secondary_outcome.measure: Endoscopic evaluation of inflammation before/after therapy
secondary_outcome.description: Endoscopic assessment of esophageal signs of eosinophilic esophagitis (white exsudates, furrows, edema, rings, crepe paper, stricture
Evaluation of symptoms via questionnaire before/after therapy

arm_group.description: Patients with eosinophilic esophagitis after exclusion of GERD

intervention.description: High resolution manometry of the esophagus

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
• patients with eosinophilic inflammation of the esophagus
Exclusion Criteria:
- refusal to participate in study
- pregnancy
- eosinophilic gastroenteritis
- Achalasia
- contraindication for gastroscopy / HRM / 24-h-pH/Impedance-monitoring
- contraindication for therapy with budesonide
- eosinophilic inflammation due to GERD
